title: International DeeJay Gigolo Records
text:
International DeeJay Gigolo Records is a German <a href="electronic%20music">electronic music</a> <a href="record%20label">record label</a> run by <a href="techno">techno</a> artist <a href="DJ%20Hell">DJ Hell</a> (real name Helmut Geier). The label was founded in <a href="Munich">Munich</a> in <a href="1996%20in%20music">1996</a> as an affiliate of label Disko B. It is Germany's most successful electronic music record label, specialising in <a href="electro%20%28music%29">electro</a>, <a href="house%20music">house</a> and <a href="techno">techno</a> with 80's pop and disco influences. "Gigolo" has released records by <a href="Dave%20Clarke%20%28techno%20DJ%29">Dave Clarke</a>, <a href="Jeff%20Mills">Jeff Mills</a>, <a href="DJ%20Hell">DJ Hell</a>, David Carretta, <a href="Miss%20Kittin">Miss Kittin</a> & <a href="The%20Hacker">The Hacker</a>, <a href="Kiko%20%26amp%3B%20Gino%20S.">Kiko & Gino S.</a>, <a href="DJ%20Naughty">DJ Naughty</a>, <a href="The%20Penelopes">The Penelopes</a>, <a href="The%20Advent">The Advent</a>, <a href="Dopplereffekt">Dopplereffekt</a>, Terrence Fixmer, <a href="Japanese%20Telecom">Japanese Telecom</a>, <a href="Fischerspooner">Fischerspooner</a>, <a href="Tiga%20%28musician%29">Tiga</a>, <a href="Belgian%20Dj%20Valium">Belgian Dj Valium</a>, <a href="Princess%20Superstar">Princess Superstar</a> and <a href="Vitalic">Vitalic</a>. In particular, the label is widely credited as being the germ cell of the <a href="electroclash">electroclash</a> music genre in the late 1990s.
Gigolo's most successful release came in 2001, with <a href="Vitalic">Vitalic</a>'s "Poney EP" (which included techno favourite "La Rock 01" on the B-side). This EP was remastered and re-issued in 2006. The label also releases showcase compilations, sometimes called "We Are Gigolo", of which there are now twelve volumes. After several successful years in Munich, the label moved its office to <a href="Berlin">Berlin</a> in the mid-2000s.
